string-array.name: medic_verb_about
string-array.item: A new model of an experimental armor-piercing rifle that allows you to hit a target with cluster charges.
A pump-action shotgun that uses magazines to speed up reloading.
An American pump-action shotgun manufactured by Remington Arms Company, Inc. Widely used for sports shooting, hunting and self-defense
Combat shotgun, which was produced by the Italian arms company Franchi S. p. A. in 1979-2000
Tactical pump-action shotgun, an improved version of the Mossberg 590
12-gauge smoothbore shotgun, made according to the bullpup scheme
Turkish rifle with vertical magazine, designed according to advanced standards and using modern materials
A special combat model of the American Remington 870 pump-action shotgun, which is manufactured by Remington Arms Company, Inc.
Drum rifle, developed in 1990 by the Central Design and Research Bureau of Sports and Hunting Weapons (TsKIB SOO) in Tula
12-gauge combat shotgun based on the Kalashnikov assault rifle, available in various modifications
The main advantage of Hawk Pump over its competitors is its balance
The Nova rifle is one of the latest developments of the famous Italian company Benelli Arms
A 12-gauge semi-automatic rifle manufactured by the Italian company Benelli Armi SpA. Automation works on the principle of removal of powder gases
A smoothbore rifle developed by the American company SRM Arms Inc. The ammunition supply is carried out with the help of a detachable rotary magazine for 16 rounds
Self-loading carbine, which is produced at the Molot machine-building plant
12-gauge hunting carbine based on the Kalashnikov assault rifle, available in various modifications

string-array.name: medic_kred_about
string-array.item: Smoothbore semi-automatic rifle, created by the Italian company Benelli Armi SpA.
Israeli 12-gauge rifle with a roomy tube magazine, made according to the "bull-pop" scheme.
A modified version of the" Saiga " in the bullpup layout. The gun is manufactured by Center Balanced Systems.
A new pump-action shotgun in the bull-pop layout, developed by the American company Kel-Tec.
Turkish semi-automatic rifle of 12-caliber, developed on the basis of the AR-15 platform and almost repeating it in shape.
Marlin 1894 Custom — a new weapon of the medic, when you get acquainted with which you immediately remember two unique guns.
Uzkon UNG-12 fully automatic shotgun has a high rate of fire, creating a serious threat to a whole group of opponents at close range.
The Origin-12 self-loading smoothbore rifle is developed and manufactured by a small American weapons company, Fostech Outdoors.
The famous American weapons designer John Moses Browning originally proposed using a scheme with a longitudinal-sliding reload forearm.
Pump-action shotgun 12-gauge, made according to the bull-pop scheme.
Italian rifle manufactured by Franchi S. p.A., based on the SPAS-12.
A 12-gauge automatic rifle developed by the Pancor Corporation. Automatic rifle works by moving the barrel forward under the pressure of gases.
Turkish semi-automatic 12-gauge shotgun developed by Derya Arms.
A 12-gauge revolver-type combat rifle developed in South Africa by Hilton Walker in the early 80s.

string-array.name: medic_box_about
string-array.item: An Italian three-barrelled shotgun developed by Chiappa Firearms.
A self-loading rifle developed by Fabarm. It has a high rate of fire and low recoil.
Automatic rifle, developed by Maxwell Atchisson in 1972, based on the experience of the Vietnam War
Military model of the Remington 870 pump-action shotgun with a Knight Armament guide that allows you to set the sight and a convenient butt
Saiga-12C-a modified version of the conventional Saiga with an elongated trunk. Weapons of this series are famous for their reliability and efficiency
An automatic shotgun developed in South Korea by Daewoo Precision Industries in the late 1980s.
Modified version of the Mossberg 500 rifle with guide system, MagPul MBUS sight, Forend plastic handguard and SGA Stock stock
A modern 12-gauge shotgun, made according to the bull-pop scheme. Rotating cylinders for six rounds are used to feed the weapon
A modern semi-automatic rifle developed by the Italian company Fabarm. It is distinguished by thoughtful ergonomics and excellent balance
Tactical pump-action shotgun, created by innovative technologies. It compares favorably with other similar weapons in terms of compactness and reliability in combat.
Smoothbore shotguns of the Italian company Fabarm S. p. A are designed for the services of order protection, security
Compact pump-action shotgun, developed on the basis of the UZI submachine gun and designed for combat in conditions of short firing range
The DP-12 pump-action smoothbore rifle is developed and manufactured by the American Standard Manufacturing company
